website_summaries.verdict: Excellent build quality for a tiny claw hammer. Only 6 inches in length, so it can be used in small areas.
pros: Weighs only 8 ounces, so anyone can lift and use it comfortably
Magnetic hammer head to help hold nail in place
Contoured grip on the handle makes it easy to hold sturdily
Good construction quality for a low-priced specialty hammer that works well for driving nails in tight spaces
Easily fits in a small toolbox
cons: Too small and lightweight for tough projects or for all-day construction jobs

customer_reviews.title: This Hammer is a HIT
customer_reviews.text: I never knew a small hammer would be so handy. My wife had a tack hammer she used for hanging and rehanging pictures and did not want to get rid of it. With this one the old hammer is toast! It is nice looking, very sturdy, and has enough mass to do most jobs. It will outlast me (not saying much as I am 78.) I can find not downside for this big little hammer
customer_reviews.author: James T. Brady

customer_reviews.title: Perfection in a Small Package
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this “baby” hammer. I didn’t realize how many things in the house that this has come in handy to use without having to grab the bigger one. It is heavy without being unwieldy. The finger grips are perfect for my smaller hands making it easy to get a great grip. Definitely can’t be without this little but powerful product. Thanks Maxcraft for thinking of us!
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine H.

customer_reviews.title: stubby claw hammer
customer_reviews.text: A tiny giant of a hammer. Easy to hold. Love the nail starter slot on end. This is a huge advantage to driving in those smaller nails without hitting your own hand. Place nail in slot, head facing handle and hammer away. Once nail is started, drop the hammer slightly to disengage the nail starter and finish hammering in the nail. Fits my cargo pant pockets easily. It is a true claw hammer so extracting nails is easy. Weight is about 8 ounces and fits my hand. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Nana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little hammer for big people
customer_reviews.text: Great "big person" hammer for "little" jobs. This is no kids toy! Very sturdy, seems well made, finger grips are for a regular sized hand (again not a kids sized hammer!) I wanted a lighter hammer for inside use like hanging pictures and etc. and this fits the bill and small enough to store in the utility drawer. Bonus magnetic nail holder on the nose!
customer_reviews.author: Emma James

customer_reviews.title: Great Hammer
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. I use it when I occasionally have to use a punch to disassemble one of my pens. Nice grip, but I use it sideways to give me a larger striking surface to avoid whacking the hades out of my hand with a mishit. For a regular homeowner with the very occasional repair, this would fit easily in a drawer. You wouldn't want to frame a house with this little guy, but if I could only have two hammers, this would be one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Big Steve from Seymour (by Gawd) Texas

customer_reviews.title: Very nice hammer
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a little on the clumsy side, and regular hammers are risky for me - so many bruised thumbs! I usually hold a normal hammer halfway up the handle, for better control. Now I don't have to. This is better - not only do I have much more control, but it's weighted so well! This might be the most well-weighted hammer I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Koudry

customer_reviews.title: Stubby Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Laughed when I saw my neighbor had one of these. I razzed him calling him "Bob The Builder". He swore by it. A few months later, I ran across this hammer here on Amazon. Thought why not, the price is cheap. Wow. Why did I think I could live without one of these. The more you use it, you'll agree.
customer_reviews.author: G. Foreman

customer_reviews.title: Nicely done, and yes, it works well as a 'real' hammer
customer_reviews.text: Trying to keep everything small for our new, tiny New York apartment. Was wondering if this would be less usable for basic nail-driving duties due to the small size, but happy to report that it works perfectly well while taking up much less space in my kitchen tool drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect hammer for especially women who have arthritic hands and it's hard to hold anything, particularly trying to use a hammer for the little things you need to do around the house. The short handle makes it easy to control and hit the object just where you want to. Really, really great for around the house!
customer_reviews.author: luckyme

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly compact. Great for camping.
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this for my birthday to put in our camping box. I use it to pound in stakes for our tent. It works very well for this purpose, and it's compact enough not to be a bother. It has extra weight in the head so it can be used effectively. It comes with a rubber cover for the claw end which makes it less likely to puncture something or get snagged on other equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Sokolowsky

customer_reviews.title: Not A Substitute For A Regular Hammer
customer_reviews.text: In the end this is a great Claw Hammer, maybe not full tang, but oh well. What I'd like you to know though is that for normal application (like what you'd be doing with an everyday hammer 95% of the time) this hammer is NOT for you! I stupidly thought that having a good quality small hammer would substitute fine for a regular one as I am tight for space as I travel---nope! Just buy a regular all-metal hammer that will give you the power you need and last you near a lifetime---although if you thought this was obvious then you're the smarter guy/gal than I, and have a good day.
customer_reviews.author: Horanano

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for getting into small places and handling projects around ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for getting into small places and handling projects around the house. Also, this little stubby guy is so much easier for me to use than a large, full size hammer. My only ish with this item is the magnetic nail holder the description mentions really isn't much of a help. Disclaimer, I am a 20ish chick, so this was just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Gabs

customer_reviews.title: You can never have too many file cabinets, too large a computer hard drive, or too many hammers.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little hammer! You wouldn't want to roof your house with it, but this will meet the needs for all those little inside chores. Just feels good in one's hand, mine weighs in at 13 oz. Pperfect for those small jobs and easy to store in a handy place.
customer_reviews.author: Springer Pup

customer_reviews.title: Packs a great punch!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect hammer for my small hands and it packs a great punch! I needed something not so long and awkward to drive concrete nails and this is working out so good that I am using it for everything! Love the handle, makes it so much easier to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: It'll get plenty of use
customer_reviews.text: It is well-made, well-finished, perfectly weighted and balanced. Good ribbed rubber hand grip. Nail groove came in handy when up on a ladder. This is one of those things I put off because I have hammers, and the cost. It's pricey for a midget hammer ($14). It's a hammer doesn't need to be put away, it'll get plenty of use. Update: Not pleased that the price came down by half. Grrr.
customer_reviews.author: FogNamedKarl

customer_reviews.title: I like the size and grip.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. I wanted a hammer that could handle light to moderate projects. I found it. The grips on the handle are perfect for me. I have medium sized hands and am a woman. The full size hammers can be pretty bulky for what I use them for.
customer_reviews.author: Lori S

customer_reviews.title: Hammer It Home Stubby Style!
customer_reviews.text: Ooooo do I love this stubby claw hammer! I got a 2nd hammer for upstairs so I don't have to run to the garage for small jobs upstairs like hanging pictures or tapping home a shelf or bar. THIS hammer is just right! The magnetic holder really helps "lend a hand" and it's just the right size for my hand. I like the grip a lot and it's easy to place nails.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Ashe

customer_reviews.title: Boom!
customer_reviews.text: Totally agree with all the other good reviews here. Great little hammer! The weight is perfect: "just heavy enough" to get a good hit in, but not too heavy as to be annoying. The balance is right-on, and the grip is perfect, too (comfortable, but rugged): a good grip-size for most hands. And the overall size of the hammer is PERFECT for what it's mean for. No, this is not my main hammer. I have a couple bigger, fancier ones, as well as a medium-sized "old fashioned" wooden handle hammer. They all get use. But this is the hammer that gets the MOST use because i keep it in my drill bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jungle NYC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small jobs!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little hammer... it's perfect for me on my small projects! I can put it in a tool bag in my car as well. Love the fact that the claw end comes with a rubber cover as well which makes it perfect for storage! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Donna T.

customer_reviews.title: Effective!
customer_reviews.text: This little hammer is a lifesaver. I thought it might not work as well because there's less leverage with a small handle but it works great. I use this to nail picture frames to the wall and also to nail back down a stubborn nail that protruded from my floor. So easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: ksh1350

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: i love the small hammer it go well in tight space where you can use a normal hammer. Best buy for me i work in maintenance in large complex. Having the right tool is everything
customer_reviews.author: A5

customer_reviews.title: Better than a normal hammer
customer_reviews.text: Good for a skinny guy with small hands. Not heavy at all and can get a good purchase on the handle for a guy with small hands like me. The small size makes hitting nails more precise because there isn't much extra material to be swung.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson America

customer_reviews.title: Great little hammer to get the job done around the house!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hammer as I didn't have a big hammer but wanted the flexibility of both storage, size, and utility. This does all 3. It gives you the weight to easily knock in a nail. Would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: B P

customer_reviews.title: Great little hammer, the slot for the nail is useless.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily for the little nail slot since I'm usually high up on a latter solo hanging things, essentially does nothing. Everything else about it is great though.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Larsen

customer_reviews.title: "In the house" hammer.
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for an 'in the house' hammer and this fits in desk/kitchen drawers much easier. Wife loves the grip and calls it hers, but I really like it too! It's got great weight and solid steel full size power. MFG advice, use a less gummy glue for your bar code sticker please! (not bad enough to dock a star but had to work at it to get it completely off).
customer_reviews.author: Rock Edge

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite tool
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best thngs I have bought in a long time! Short handle makes it easier for a woman to hold and use. Wish I had this a long time ago. #KC5Star
customer_reviews.author: Wild lavender

customer_reviews.title: Nail, Nail
customer_reviews.text: Very handy hammer. I am pleased with it. It is somewhat heavy, but it fits my small hands just fine. I like the fact it is not so big and cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: May Eve

customer_reviews.title: SMALL HAMMER, HUGE HIT!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW, THIS HAMMER IS COOL!! It packs the punch of a regular-sized hammer, but gets into tighter places and does what is expected of it very well. I love the magnetic head of it too, enabling it to hold and guide nails without crunching my fingers or finger nails!! It is the best value on the entire web, at Amazon also!! I checked. lol... Its grip is very comfortable, especially for large hands like mine. Quite surprising. It's well balanced and really solid feel in your hand. I recommend this for all the tool boxes of the world.
customer_reviews.author: ERIC T.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for mobile tool bag
customer_reviews.text: This hammer is perfect for a mobile tool bag versus full size that stays in the garage. And you don't really sacrifice much. Very solid, heavy construction, well balanced for accurate striking, ergonomic grip.
customer_reviews.author: JLC

customer_reviews.title: Big Value, Small Price!
customer_reviews.text: Great little hammer to get in those tight spots! Nail holder works nice, could be. A touch heavier but no biggie, still does what it needs to get done.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I love this hammer. For someone who has small hands and the fact that it is short, gives the user more control over the long handled hammers I use this whenever I am using large nails or small nails
customer_reviews.author: Selective Lady

customer_reviews.title: I like this one better than my own
customer_reviews.text: Great for little hands. I bought this for my son's toolbox. It fits wonderfully in his hand although it's a bit heavier than I expected. I find myself grabbing for his Hammer more than I do my own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy!
customer_reviews.text: As a women, I need my own tools ;) I do have a toolbox with a full size hammer, drill etc. My toolbox is never handy....this is in my kitchen junk drawer, no more meat cleaver hammer for this girl ;)
customer_reviews.author: missusms

customer_reviews.title: Gift wrapping could be deceptive!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as part of a Christmas present for my wife. She wanted a small tool set for the house and this is the hammer I got for the set. When she was opening the package and felt the handle she asked if she should open this in front of the kids. It definitely wasn't what she thought but she was happy for the hammer anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Good compact tool
customer_reviews.text: My wife needed a small hammer to take to work and tack things on the wall from time to time. This hammer fits the bill nicely. It has a fairly light weight head and small size, but is great for what's needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Stubby Claw Hammer
customer_reviews.text: Fast ship. Professional packaging. Works as stated. great product, makes life much easier. Great invention. One of the best tools I have ever purchased. Recommend highly. Anthony. H. Burlington.MA.
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY HAMBOYAN

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and weight
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and weight. Who wants to bring a big hammer camping or to the lake or to the soccer game to stake down your tent or shade? No one. This is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: HB

customer_reviews.title: Works well but was a little scratched up when I got it
customer_reviews.text: Like another reviewer, mine was scratched up and scuffed when I got it. I wanted something smaller to keep in a kitchen drawer, for the simple things around the house that didn't require a full sized hammer. The grip is comfortable, and there's actually enough heft here that you can power through larger things as well when needed if you don't feel like digging out the full sized hammer. But it works great for simple things like putting nails in drywall for pictures and such. For a small, inexpensive little hammer, it does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: LegoDadTop Contributor: Architecture

customer_reviews.title: For once being short is a good thing!  A great little hammer with a magnetic nail holder!
customer_reviews.text: The hammer is great! Being that short is a disadvantage in that you don't get the leverage of the handle to pound the nail, but it works great in an area where there is not much room to swing the hammer. My wife loves hers. Another feature that I really like is the magnetic nail holder. Just put the nail in the magnetic holder in the head, and plant the hammer where you want the nail. It saves many smashed fingers and is really nice and works incredibly well.
customer_reviews.author: Rolla Gravett

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect for getting into small or tight areas that regular size hammer won't fit. It saved the day when our water pipes froze up in the past extreme cold temperatures (-18 and -20 degrees for over three days straight). My husband was able to use it to get into small tight areas and put additional heat tapes on our water pipes. He would never have been able to get to some of the places with a regular size hammer. It also is a good solid made item, and not something that will fall apart easily.
customer_reviews.author: It's me in central Illinois

customer_reviews.title: Tiny hammer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 year old because he loves tools. This is a great size for him and he loved getting this as a gift. Now to put him to work.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Nifty Little Stubby Hammer :)
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to buy an assortment of basic hand tools - mine all disappeared during a divorce ;(. I'm a smaller female & need smaller than average tools. I'm very happy with this little guy. The molded grip fits my hand perfectly & comfortably and I find it very well balanced. It looks and feels well made. I don't think this hammer would fit well in a hand larger than "small" (ladies glove size 7-9) or even most men's hands.
customer_reviews.author: silvia in Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer for light work or tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hammer because I wanted something that would fit in the "junk drawer" that would handle the day-to-day, small project things I don't need my full graphite work horse hammer for, like hanging pictures and such. This is perfect for that. It sits nicely in a little tray, gives me the full weight swing I'm accustomed to, and didn't break the bank either. Would recommend for little projects (or tight spaces) without a doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Allison N Hurd

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a tool of quality, very durable not flimsy and a great grip. Make sure you check the size of the tool in inches because some are smaller than you might think, in my case it was the size that I exactly want it. There are other larger sizes of course. Nonetheless whatever size you purchase it is a great tool
customer_reviews.author: EdP

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: This hammer fits my hand and is perfect for my odd jobs. I won't be using it to pound in a nail from further than 6" or about, so the length is perfect. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: EMT

customer_reviews.title: Small but functional
customer_reviews.text: I put together a small go-bag of tools for the car/kitchen, just as a fun hobby. It has only the smallest, most compact versions of all major tools... universal socket wrenches, multi-tip ratcheting screwdrivers, vice grips, etc. This hammer is very small and you won't have any fun driving a 10-penny nail with it but it is functional and study... it's perfect for my diminutive toolkit.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gamble

customer_reviews.title: Great for women and small hands
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous little hammer. But do not let size fool you this puppy is heavy and still gives you the leverage you need in tight places. i bought this one to have in the car with the rest of my tools. but since I was running out of space this fit the bill. it was even better when it arrived. It was easy to hold I could get a great grip on it as the handle is rubber and it works like a regular long handled hammer, as my Mom ended up testing for me and I almost lost it to her.
customer_reviews.author: Love Firefly

customer_reviews.title: Handy Hammer
customer_reviews.text: Hammers are always awkward for me. The handles are too long, and I'm not in any profession that would make me care to learn how to "handle" them properly. All I know, and all I need to know is "hammer pound, hammer fix". This hammer fits comfortably/perfectly in my hand, giving me a perfect grip, and a faster, easier put together and/or repair. I wish I found this wonderful thing way before now!
customer_reviews.author: N.

customer_reviews.title: I used this every day as a Carpenter for years ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this every day as a Carpenter for years. I got laughed at when I pulled it out, but after a few hours on the job I would have to fight everyone to keep them away from it. It works ridiculously well. It's not a framing hammer, but it will do just about anything else you can need it for
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Nice small hammer.  Comfortable grip, QUALITY construction.
customer_reviews.text: Nice small hammer. Comfortable grip, QUALITY construction. Good for light work around the house. Most of the time I will use a heavier hammer, but when you need something smaller, this is a small hammer with a nice grip. Doesn't feel like a toy. I also bought one of these for both of my daughters for small repair jobs. They both like it's weight and feel for small household repairs.
customer_reviews.author: blu-ray!!!

customer_reviews.title: Wife really likes this The right size for her projects ...
customer_reviews.text: Wife really likes this The right size for her projects.Not heavy and a decent price.You can even hang it up.Hung hers in the washer/dryer room.
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer. Good weighted head
customer_reviews.text: Great hammer. Good weighted head. Substantial. Yet, small, compact. Several handymen that have seen it or used it have been envious of it. I bought it for camping, to use with tent stakes. It doesn't take up so much room. But it's great for around the house too. I have to keep a close eye on it, because it's so well liked, I don't want it to accidentally end up with someone else's tools.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry A. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great little hammer
customer_reviews.text: I am a benchrest shooter and needed a hammer to pack in my wind flags box so if I need to stake my flags to the ground I could. Because of space issues and weight issues I was tickled when I found this little guy. It fits perfect in my back pocket when walking down range. It fits perfect in my box because I don't have to deal with a long handle. The grip on it is very nice making it easy for me to hold on to with my arthritic hands. I don't need a heavy duty all the time usage hammer and this is just perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: Nice little hammer
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for quick chores around the house. Very lightweight but sturdy and feels comfortable in your hand. Haven't used the magnetic nail started yet but looks like it would work well. Not sure I would use this for framing a house but it should hold up well for most projects around the house. The head is strong and fairly large (the handle is really the only thing that's smaller than normal). Great little hammer for the price!
customer_reviews.author: reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good little stubby
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these. Bought one as a gift for a female family member who enjoys doing small repairs around the house. Bought another for myself for a tool kit for my vehicle. It's small, not a hammer you want to be driving big nails with all day long. But it has it's place. Has a nice, comfortable grip, and after you swing it a few times, you get used to the balance. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.

customer_reviews.title: Feels Great / Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Small size gives you the control you need for smaller jobs, such as hammering in wiring staples. Still has good weight comparable to larger hammers. Feel *great* in the hand, and is a joy to use. Actually feels like some love went into the design, which is a rarity today. One of those tools you'll be delighted to own and use.
customer_reviews.author: WanJae

customer_reviews.title: Good hammer
customer_reviews.text: Good hammer but poor quality control. Adhesive was dripped and hardened over the sides and part of the rubber has already come off.
customer_reviews.author: Bry

customer_reviews.title: for garden tool bag
customer_reviews.text: not a heavy duty hammer; just wanted a small compact hammer for my gardening tool bag; don't often use, but seems to serve the purpose
customer_reviews.author: donna tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer for tight spots
customer_reviews.text: This is a somewhat specialised tool. But I had a need for a hammer that could be used in tight spaces and this definitely fit the bill. It is well built and should last me a lifetime. However, due to its size it lacks the leverage of a larger hammer and shouldn't be the only hammer in the tool box. But when the fit is tight this little hammer is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: R. Horn

customer_reviews.title: It has a short handle and I thought he's laugh it off but instead he really loved it. It's well constructed with a really solid
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my husband. It has a short handle and I thought he's laugh it off but instead he really loved it. It's well constructed with a really solid grip and it fits perfect in our household tool box. It is a great tool for around the house. I'd buy this item from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Lion Heart

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice little hammer
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little hammer. It doesn't take up much space in my toolbox. It does the job. It did arrive with scratches and dents in it, which I am not happy about and would have given it five stars if it weren't for that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: never showed up
customer_reviews.text: I never received, was looking forward to this item as it looked like a very useful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Dchusn

customer_reviews.title: it works great for tapping door hinge pins out and minor umph ...
customer_reviews.text: the only reason I bought this was because it does not take up much room in my maintenance cart. it works great for tapping door hinge pins out and minor umph on trying to break fittings loose. its good for tapping and freeing up rust and pulling nails. its not for carpentry work its just a handy quick lightweight tool
customer_reviews.author: kevin henson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality secondary hammer
customer_reviews.text: Well Balanced, easy to use, and reliable. It is the best hammer to build IKEA(it does not require a heavy job) 한 손에 꼭 들어오는 망치입니다. 균형이 꽤 잘 잡혀있어 손이 편합니다. 콘트리트 벽에 못을 박는것 같은 어려운 일은 힘들구요. 간단하게 나무판에 못 박거나 뽑고, 이케아 조립하는 정도에 유용합니다. 집에 이거 하나만 놓고 쓰기에는 아쉬움이 있지만 정말 가끔 쓰는 빡센 작업 때문에 이것보다 큰 망치를 사는 것보다 큰 망치가 하나에 추가하여 이 망치 하나 구비해 두시면 95% 이상은 이 망치를 쓰게 될껍니다.
customer_reviews.author: Gaster

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I had always wanted to pick up a mini hammer to be more accommodating when sometimes stuck in confined spaces.....I love this hammer,Im just giving it 1 point lower for review since I'm still not getting used to the different swing & momentum of this particular tool...otherwise I highly recommend getting one still.
customer_reviews.author: Lane B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Construction Quality, Perfect Sze and Weight, at a Very Reasonable Price!  Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent construction quality combined with a very compact, light weight hammer. An incredible value! Highly recommended if you need a compact hammer!
customer_reviews.author: Steward H.

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: These little guys won't replace your full size hammer, but can be incredibly handy for small jobs or tight places where a full size hammer would be very difficult to use. Everyone that I gave one to loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Jones

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little hammer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little hammer. Fits in your backpack or tool box easily. Very ergonomic and works well. Good price for this little Giant.
customer_reviews.author: Travis E. Castro

customer_reviews.title: Every toolbag needs a hammer and if your tight on space this is the ticket.
customer_reviews.text: If your tight on space you need one of these. Don't realize how much I was depriving myself without a hammer in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: JayL

customer_reviews.title: Just fun and effective
customer_reviews.text: Just love little hammer's because I don't have the strength I once did. Most small hammer's aren't as useful as this one is. I have no trouble getting the swing right go the nails go right in after only a few blows. It is well balanced and comfortable to hold. Highly recommend this as it's probably the only hammer you'll ever use again.
customer_reviews.author: Pennye E Parker

customer_reviews.title: LIL STUBBS
customer_reviews.text: This was the first purchase I made when I moved into my first apartment. LOVE this guy and have it in my toolbox till the day. Lil' stubbs gets it done in the tight spaces
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Durable hammer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hammer and it gets the job done for at home day to day tasks. I’ve had this hammer for a year gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Guru

customer_reviews.title: Strange look hammer but feels good in my hand and seems to be easier to ...
customer_reviews.text: Strange look hammer but feels good in my hand and seems to be easier to control should be great for hanging pictures and other wall decorations.
customer_reviews.author: philt1

customer_reviews.title: Robust but Compact
customer_reviews.text: Short review: This thing is awesome. It's got just enough weight and size to be useful for small tasks and yet it's light enough and compact enough to be portable and easily stored. If you're looking for a solid small hammer to "knock-out" daily around-the-house tasks....Look no further because you found it. I recently used this to do some picture hanging and building some IKEA furniture and I couldn't be happier with it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: whizdumb

customer_reviews.title: A handy tool that doesn't take up much room.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I'm buying one of these. One was in my tool bad for two years and came in handy quite a few times. Small enough as to not take up too much room in my tool bag, but big enough to get the job done. After my car was broken into and my tools were stolen, I just had to get another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Havent used a regular 16oz since I got it
customer_reviews.text: This is not a piece of junk at all and the nail starter feature actually works for my kids. Personally I dont think you have enough control of where its going to use it for much. I mostly use a hammer for rawl plugs into concrete but its been doing minor chiseling as the need be too. For heavy chiseling I anyway use a SDS. Bought to lighten my toolbox and it exceeds expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Avrohom

customer_reviews.title: Great for small projects
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my light around the house jobs. It is on the small side, has a great grip and works for everything I need a hammer for.
customer_reviews.author: prettisiditty1908

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should
customer_reviews.text: This works great for its designed purpose of working in tight spaces. Your arm will be doing most of the work as the handle is to short for the hammer head to do the work. The handle is solid and it even has a nail holder. Its a useful tool for your toolbox. Update:-I just got my monies worth by pounding out a stuck hitch pin that none of my other hammers could get to.
customer_reviews.author: Bongo

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to the tool belt
customer_reviews.text: Nice size for a tool belt or box. I do like the nail holding feature, but still have not perfected the art of quickly placing the nail in the correct slot. Leverage is tough to get on this, as the item is very short. Well built. You'll likely be using your normal hammer for most day-to-day jobs, but this puppy is a nice inexpensive addition to the tool chest.
customer_reviews.author: keta377

customer_reviews.title: It has held up beautifully and is the go-to hammer choice around here
customer_reviews.text: We have been so impressed with this little hammer. I have three kids ages 6,7 and 8 and they have all been enjoying it over the past year. It has held up beautifully and is the go-to hammer choice around here. It is tough enough to get the job done, but easy enough for a young child to handle as well. I use it for hanging pictures in the home as well as for wood-working projects. The kids use it to hammer together small pieces of wood or hammer nails into tree stumps. It is a very therapeutic activity for them! Highly recommend this hammer adults and children!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: bought for the wife,less damage to walls then when she hangs pictures with a waffle head lol
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: Good for finish nails
customer_reviews.text: Food for little finish nails but that is about it
customer_reviews.author: MistOfAshes

customer_reviews.title: Good small hammer
customer_reviews.text: Good small hammer. Heavier than some other small hammers. I travel with this (in a carry-on on airplanes) so important to have tools that are under 6". TSA will take tools that are longer.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Z

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little shorter than expected but sturdy. As long as it gets the job done I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Alina BG

customer_reviews.title: Little hammer big bang!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect hammer for women. If you are short, tiny, or have small hands this hammer is exceptional. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Fryd

customer_reviews.title: Great Compact Hammer
customer_reviews.text: Love this little hammer. Got it for my hands on 4 year old. It is a little heavy, but not as heavy as a long handled hammer. It has a hole on the top of the hammer. Finally realized it is so you can push in a nail to start it. Very convenient feature I personally had never seen before. I have found myself grabbing this hammer over our long handle one.
customer_reviews.author: Orvin C. Jenks

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my 7 yr old nephew who is ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my 7 yr old nephew who is obsessed with real tools now, so he "can work with dad in the wood shop."
customer_reviews.author: kayleigh little

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hammer!
customer_reviews.text: Decently priced, incredibly durable and its size makes it super handy and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: afl10

customer_reviews.title: Great for small drawers!
customer_reviews.text: A great small hammer to keep in our pen drawer in the kitchen to have handy for small projects!
customer_reviews.author: CBInteresting

customer_reviews.title: Arrived all scratched up and with glue on it
customer_reviews.text: Just received this item. I would have liked to use it as part of a gift, but it looks like it's been through a war already. Scratches all over it, and glue dripping out from where the handle is connected to the head. Very disappointed. Cannot even request a return, since apparently the item isn't eligible for returns
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Medini

customer_reviews.title: Ladies, look no further
customer_reviews.text: As a female I'm enjoying using this little hammer that I purchased for a job that was going to require precision hammering of tiny brads. I was considering something small like a tack hammer but their prices were a deterrent, esp for a one-time job. This hammer must have appeared during a search and I'm so glad it did. It was perfect for the job and it's small enough to keep in my pantry. Better yet I no longer have to dig through all the large items in my substantial Husky tool bag to get to the hammer. Did I mention it coordinates well with my Stanley All-in-One screwdriver? That's in the pantry, too. They look good together.
customer_reviews.author: Athena

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is ok but the hammer head could be a little smaller
customer_reviews.author: Mario D.

customer_reviews.title: Very cool little hammer
customer_reviews.text: Very cool little hammer. I keep it in an emergency tool box I setup for travelling. Haven't used it much, but can see it being very useful.
customer_reviews.author: soaringhawk

customer_reviews.title: Amazon hit the nail on the head with this!
customer_reviews.text: Got my hammer today. How cute! Never had one this small. I like the fact it is small and doesn't take up much space. I am a do it your self kinda girl and love home improvement products. I like the nail groove too an added plus! The rubber grip fits my hand nicely. Thanks Amazon! for making my life a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: kittylover

customer_reviews.title: Best little hammer
customer_reviews.text: My son love it I gave it to him for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... saw it but quickly realized this stubby hammer was awesome - it's the only one we use now
customer_reviews.text: My husband laughed when he first saw it but quickly realized this stubby hammer was awesome - it's the only one we use now!
customer_reviews.author: stargazer

customer_reviews.title: handy "little" tool
customer_reviews.text: I've been putting together a small portable tool kit so I can have most necessary tools available in just one tool bag. Though this will not give you the leverage if a full sized hammer, it does a surprisingly good job of tackling most tasks I've done with it. it can be just what you need in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Ellenbacher

customer_reviews.title: Great stubby!
customer_reviews.text: I've had several of these stubby hammers, but this is a first for this brand. I like the magnetic feature and that it has a little xtra weight (8.8oz). Nice little stubby!
customer_reviews.author: lmrakowski

customer_reviews.title: Love Stubby Tools!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 7 year old grandson for his new tool chest. And, as a grandmother, they were a perfect fit for me, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Canuk 45

customer_reviews.title: great for work in tight places with potent swing weight
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my 7 year old grandson and is a very practical tool for any adult as well; great for work in tight places with potent swing weight. Love the articulated grip.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lawrence Houseal

product_meta.title: Maxcraft 60626 8-oz. Stubby Claw Hammer
product_meta.description: MAXCRAFT 60626 8-oz. Stubby Claw Hammer:Full size 8 oz. forged steel claw head, Magnetic head holds nail for one-handed starting, Soft, non-slip, contoured handle grip, Stubby 6-inch length for small jobs or tight work areas, Quality guarantee
feature_bullets: Full size 8 oz. forged steel claw head
Magnetic head holds nail for one-handed starting
Stubby 6 in. length for small jobs or tight work areas
